page.title: 08History Of Winchmore Hill.
page.content: This is a description of the history of Winchmore Hill taken from an interview with a lady who has lived there for sixty five years. A great deal of modernisation has taken place including the laying of an electricity supply and water mains.The local public house has trebled in size whilst old cottages have been preserved.The local church and Penn Street were built from local stone which was collected from the common by local women.All new houses built must have a gable and any extentions must be undertaken so as to leave the original appearance of the house unaltered.Any new walls must contain flint taken from the old wall so as to retain the period appearance. The local pond was dug to provide clay for pottery.It was filled in when a boy died in a skating accident.
